content.description: Stick clip the first bolt just above the horizontal feature that spans this whole northern side of the rock. Climb on somewhat chossy jugs for the bottom slight overhang. Pull into the small dihedral as the angle eases up. Jugs for the most part to the anchors, which can be clipped from below (high clip) or at waist height (jugs above).
content.protection: 3 bolts to chain anchors with carabiners
content.location: North side of the rock formation, just downhill of a second, smaller, buried rock formation (10 ft high or so). This is the only route on the north side that is fully bolted.

content.description: Pull some reasonably tough moves on an overhang at the bottom of this route. Make use of some side pulls on the bottom of the dihedral to your right, then swing out left to your choice of small left hand crimps at the roof. Cross over the right hand to a jug, and then move the left hand up to a monster jug for clipping just above the roof. The crux is just above this, pulling the bulge, as the jugs more or less disappear.
content.protection: 6 bolts to chain anchors with carabiners (shared with route to right)
content.location: There's a small dihedral with a roof to the left of it on the southwestern side of the formation. This route climbs just below the roof, and is the left of two lines that are side-by-side.

content.description: Climb of the dihedral to the right of the roof. The bottom is a little overhung, but pulling into the dihedral makes things a lot easier. Slab terrain to the top after the midpoint.
content.protection: 6 bolts to two chain anchors with carabiners (shared with route to left)
content.location: This route is to the right of the roof on the southwestern side of the formation.

content.description: Vertical climbing on mostly jugs, that eventually pulls into easy slab climbing to anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts to chain anchors with carabiners.
content.location: The southern most route on the rocket formation. This is at the lowest point, with a fairly flat belay area.

content.description: Stick clip the first bolt. Try to find feet that won't break off at the bottom to reach a really nice, positive left hand side pull. The route is somewhat overhung at the bottom. Work your way either straight up, or slightly left on mostly jugs where reach will help. Pull yourself up to a vertical/slab middle section. The top is mostly vertical with a technical move or two, followed by jugs to pull over on to slab. Easy climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts to chain anchors with carabiners.
content.location: Starts on the face just left of the crack, but still on the eastern side of the rock formation. Belay is on angled ground.

content.description: Chimney up the fairly wide crack. Pull onto the left face at the top to reach anchors. There are optional jugs the whole way up, so chimneying is not required if that's not your thing.
content.protection: 5 bolts to chain anchors with carabiners. The carabiners have old duct tape on them, to prevent rotation (presumably).
content.location: Southeastern side of the Light Bulb. The bolt line runs up the left side of the crack, which is clearly visible from the trail. The first bolt is reachable from the ground.
